titleStmt.title: A new-come guest to the tovvne. That is, the descriminant oath which the Earle of Newcastle imposeth upon the countie and citie of Yorke, and all others under his command and power, violently abusing them to the maintaining of this unnaturall warre against the Parliament, to the ruine of the kingdome, and themselves. Written by a Yorke-shire gentleman, for the good (especially) of his countriemen. With a particular list of the names of the most violent papists (men of that qualitie) and others that bare armes, or are ayding and assisting to the Earle of New-castle.
titleStmt.author: Yorke-shire gentleman.
Newcastle, William Cavendish, Duke of, 1592-1676, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Matthew Walbancke, at Graies-Inne Gate,

notesStmt.note: Sometimes attributed to William Cavendish, Duke of Newcastle.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
